description: A system of Romano-British enclosures between the Cotswold escarpment and Robinswood Hill. At least one of these enclosures has been interpreted as a polygonal wayside shrine.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, et al, (2015), Portway (Gloucestershire), available at: https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449
Rawes, (1984), The Romano-British Site on the Portway, near Gloucester, Trans Bristol and Gloucestershire Archaeological Society, 102
